reviews.review_msg: good class. interesting topics. HARD EXAMS!! 3 exams for intersession, aka every 2 weeks. really difficult, but the iclicker questions for attendance were easy & not marked anyway, plus the final paper is based on a movie. fun class but make sure to study the articles & their findings

Great prof, extremely interesting topics & really good articles (no textbook) to supplement lecture material. However, EXAMS ARE HARD! Focus on studies/experiments/their results/the findings.. questions are very specfic about miniscule details!!

Kim is extremely nice, and helpful. Topics were really fun and interesting. However, she sometimes engages too much with her students in class and they should just discuss at office hours. Exams were tricky.  Don't fall behind on readings. Paper was marked hard. See TA to confirm if you have applied the theories correctly to the movie.
She is an excellent professor, but the course is really a mind fck... If you must take this class, take it with her and study the stuff subjectively, never take it personal

Of course those who did well in her class will give her positive feedback. I enjoyed her lectures but when it came to her test questions, I was throughly confused. I found her test questions were ambiguous.
Great class and great prof! Lectures were interesting and relatable to everyday life. Test was pretty easy if you paid attention.

Kim is an excellent lecturer- well-spoken and entertaining. She always makes herself available to students. I really enjoyed this course, it's always a breath of fresh air when a professor is so well-versed in their field that they don't have to refer to their notes when lecturing.

Boring class, the notes were confusing and all over the place, and Kim was confusing as a prof. She contradicts herself a lot and wastes class time trying to figure out how to work her i-clicker and powerpoint. This class was boring and you'll leave lectures being even more confused than when you walked in.

SUPER easy course! Definitely take it if you need GPA boosting, the majority of the material is common sense & doesn't require attending lecture or much studying. Her lectures are okay, but she is extremely biased and can't see things from different perspectives. If you don't care about that, definitely take this course.

Kim is a fantastic professor. She manages to engage with her students in a 100+ lecture hall, is very fair with her marking and expectations of us. If you go to lecture and really think about the topics (which isn't hard -- we all have close relationships!), the content feels almost intuitive. I appreciate her teaching style and love this class!
She is a really kind person and goes out of her way to help students.
Lectures are super interesting and she is very approachable! Really enjoyed her class!

Kim is a great lecturer and its not surprising that shes been with the university for over 20yrs. however, the scale is higher for this class. participation is mandatory for 5% overall. shes informative but has tendency to ramble on about material already covered. had a class cancelled bc of snow but was still responsible for material. not cool.
Loved this class! Loved the prof! Would reccomend it to anyone, one of my faveroite classes thus far :)

I love Kim's class! Very engaging and interesting. Shes awesome! No textbook, only journal article which I didnt mind but others did complain about. Multiple choice on her exams are difficult, but written is easy. Participation marks are easy but you have to attend class. I would def take again.

Truthfully, I found her class to be more on the difficult side. She isn't a terrible prof but I wish she used a textbook as opposed to selected readings. Moreover, there's some negativity in the material! Do not be fooled, her exams are ridiculously hard. It was to the point where she had to RECURVE the class because it was too difficult.

Kim is one of my favorite profs at SFU. Lectures are clear, readings are interesting, and she does an amazing job of applying the material to real life. The essay was easy and so were the exams. It's not very hard to get a good grade in this class if you attend all the lectures and do all the readings. Kim is just great!

The class itself is really interesting and Kim does a great job at delivering the material. I also wished she used a text book rather than journals. Her SA q's are fair. The MC in her tests are HARD!! She uses so many double negatives and similar answers that make it really frustrating-which only adds to the stress, making you do even worse!!

Kim is awesome. Very interesting, funny, and knowledgeable in the area. Can't say the exams were easy, though. The MC was very tricky and I did terrible on it, while I did really well on the short answer - how is this possible? Overall, a great course, but I do wish she used a textbook other than dozens of journal articles (some 40+ pages long)!

Kim is one of the best profs I have ever had at SFU. She explains everything every clearly and makes a point of integrating student's questions and comments into her lectures. She is very knowledgeable in the area, and her tests are fair. Take her class if you can!!!!

She's really into what she teaches, but it take her FOREVER just to go over one slide or answer one question. Her tests aren't that hard, but you should attend lecture, eventhough she drags them out so long, because she adds in alot of info that isn't in her slides.

Her midterm and final are really poorly done. I recieved extremely low grades on the multiple choice, and A+'s on the short answers. I do not think this demonstrated what I knew in the course because the marks were so extreme. If you are not strong on multiple choice (although I usually am) beware of this course on your GPA.

She's the best prof in sfu..She's nice, funny, helpful and the most important, she's fair. The class was fun, you should go to class when take this course because it's fun! you'll love it..She's way better than the one teach 361

Kim was an awesome professor! Loved the class, its high interest and easy! I got an A+ without putting in too much effort. Very applicable to life and Kim is helpful! I sent her an email and she replied quickly with almost a whole page! Super impressed!
most interesting class i've taken. excellent teacher. makes you interested in the course and think about how it pertains to your own life.
very informative, knowledgeable. enjoyed her class real much!

i actually enjoyed the lecture, however the exams and essays were a different story. Not beacuse they were a bad idea, it is just that i don't like the TA marking everything, i prefer the prof to mark!!!

WOW!! What an awesome class. If you have to take Interpersonal Relationships I suggest that you definitely take it with Bartholomew and not with the alternatives. Paper was interesting and lectures very organized and applicable to life. She is the probably the best prof I've had at SFU.

Kim is an excellent prof...probably the best one ive had thus far for psych. Very interesting topic covered...paper is not too difficult b/c you are just basically analyzing a movie and applying the reltationship concepts learned in class...a very inspiring prof..enjoyed the course

i thought the midterm was quite easy.  wasnt the average 73%? usually class averages are lower. class is a little too much like reading cosmo or glamour magazine and some annoying girl always gives her thoughts about her own relationships that no one else cares about but other than that its a good course to take
she's not boring to listen to and the material isn't too dry.....worth taking

Good class, interesting, but the T.A. marked the mid-term! Most of the class did below what is normally expected. The prof must take the blame for letting the T.A. have so much say in students grades. Unless you're an A student this class will lower your GPA! Most principles learned are half-assed & disproven as is the case with most psy. theories!
awesome teacher! very clear notes, well prepared, she's done a lot of research and knows what she's talking about. Class was enjoyable
Excellent prof: clear, articulate, critical, very research minded.  Psyc 362 is a fun course, I enjoyed it.
Brilliant, kind and goes way beyond the call of duty for her students. Best teacher I've had a SFU

one of those classes where you can actually apply the stuff to real life.  One of the smartest people I've ever met - she actually came up with theories we have to read about in 100/102!  TAKE THIS CLASS!
enjoyable teacher
Ridiculously enjoyable course. I would have paid almost any price to have Kim share all of the knowledge that she did. Very research oriented, very very good.
Very very good
Interesting course.  She knows her stuff and isn't afraid to share it.
Kim is a fantastic teacher and a leading expert in her field. She is very opinionated, which is sometimes a good thing and sometimes bad...
Well organized lectures, difficult midterm...
GREAT teacher - ultra-organized, super prepared, very clear.
she is great! brilliant!
